title: NASA’s guide to space: 6 things you didn’t know about the cosmos - Hindustan Times
summary:
NASA’s guide to space: 6 things you didn’t know about the cosmos

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Space is vast and full of mysteries. Here are some surprising NASA facts that will make you look at the cosmos in a new way.

  • Venus’s day lasts 243 Earth days, but it completes a year in just 225 Earth days.
  • Space may look empty, but it’s actually filled with tiny particles like dust, gas, and cosmic rays that travel through it.
  • The universe is constantly expanding. Galaxies are moving away from us, and this is happening faster every year.
  • NASA’s spacecraft have captured sounds from space, like solar winds and cosmic vibrations.
  • Olympus Mons on Mars is the largest volcano in our solar system.
  • NASA has found evidence of ancient water flows on Mars.
The cosmos is full of wonders. NASA’s discoveries remind us how much more there is to explore.

This article highlights fascinating facts about space, encouraging curiosity and further exploration of the universe.
newTitle: NASA’s Guide to Space: Surprising Facts About the Cosmos

This is Earth this is where you live and this is where you live in your neighborhood the solar… - Medium
summary:
Exploring Our Cosmic Neighborhood: Earth and Beyond

Publication Date: Not provided

Source: Not provided

This article takes a fascinating look at Earth and its place within the solar system, sharing intriguing facts about the distances to other celestial bodies and the sizes of various planets compared to Earth.

  • The distance from Earth to the moon can reach 252,088 miles at its farthest point.
  • Saturn’s rings have fragments as large as mountains.
  • Earth compared to the sun reveals significant size disparities.
  • One million seconds is about 11.5 days, while one billion seconds equates to over 31 years.
  • The total number of stars in the universe exceeds all the grains of sand on Earth.
“The total number of stars in the universe is larger than all the grains of sand on all the beaches of the planet Earth.” – Carl Sagan

This piece emphasizes the vastness of our universe and the unique position of Earth within it, encouraging readers to appreciate their cosmic neighborhood.
newTitle: Exploring Our Cosmic Neighborhood: Earth and Beyond

title: The Sky Promises Many Big Events in 2025 - VOA Learning English
summary:
The Sky Promises Many Big Events in 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Associated Press

The world will have to wait until 2026 for the next total solar eclipse. However, the sky promises plenty of other big events in 2025.

  • Eclipses: March 14 will see a lunar eclipse visible in North and South America, followed by a partial solar eclipse two weeks later in various regions including Maine and Europe.
  • Supermoons: Three supermoons expected in October, November, and December, with November’s being closest to Earth.
  • Planet Parade: A six-planet parade in January, with additional planetary appearances into spring.
  • Northern and Southern Lights: Predictions for geomagnetic storms resulting in more auroras.
  • Meteor Showers: Expect notable meteor showers including Perseid and Geminid, along with smaller events throughout the year.
“People should go out and see them sometime during the next many weeks. I certainly will.” - Bruce Betts

As 2025 unfolds, the sky will be filled with celestial wonders, inviting everyone to look up and enjoy the spectacles.
newTitle: The Sky Promises Many Big Events in 2025

title: The Moon’s Middle Age Surprise: Evidence of a Long-Lost Magnetic Field - Indian Defence Review
summary:
The Moon’s Middle Age Surprise: Evidence of a Long-Lost Magnetic Field

Published on: January 5, 2025 | Source: Indian Defence Review

Scientists have discovered that the Moon retained a magnetic field deep into its midlife, based on groundbreaking data from China’s Chang’e 5 mission, challenging decades of assumptions about lunar history.

Key Points:

  • The Chang’e 5 mission brought back lunar samples and revealed rocks dated to 2 billion years old that were weakly magnetized.
  • Analysis shows that these rocks had a magnetic field strength of 2,000 to 4,000 nanoteslas.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“These findings could redefine our understanding of lunar resources.”

Conclusion:

The discovery of a long-lasting magnetic field on the Moon may reshape future lunar exploration and understanding of its geological history.
newTitle: An Unexpected Discovery: The Moon’s Long-Lost Magnetic Field

title: NASA to Reveal New Mars Sample Return Plans on Jan. 7 – Here’s How to Tune In - Indian Defence Review
summary:
NASA to Reveal New Mars Sample Return Plans on Jan. 7 – Here’s How to Tune In

Published on: January 5, 2025 | Source: Indian Defence Review

NASA is set to kick off 2025 with a significant announcement about its ambitious Mars Sample Return program. On Tuesday, Jan. 7, the agency will host an audio-only press conference at 1:00 p.m. EST (1800 GMT) to provide updates on the status and future of this long-term planetary exploration goal.

  • The mission faces rising costs and delays.
  • Nasa aims to reduce cost, risk, and complexity of the program.
  • The original mission cost was estimated at $3 billion, which has now escalated to $11 billion.
  • China is scheduled to launch its own Mars sample return mission in 2028.
  • The mission incorporates a greater role for private industry.
“The bottom line is that $11 billion is too expensive, and not returning samples until 2040 is unacceptably too long.” - Bill Nelson

The updated mission architecture will be revealed during the briefing, potentially reshaping the future of Martian exploration.
newTitle: NASA to Reveal New Mars Sample Return Plans on Jan. 7 – Here’s How to Tune In

January 2025 skywatching tips from NASA: Highlights - India Today
summary:
January 2025 Skywatching Tips from NASA: Highlights

Published On: Jan 6, 2025

Source: indiatodayglobal

January's night sky is brimming with celestial wonders, including a close approach of Venus and Saturn, Mars at opposition, and a stunning Moon-Mars alignment on January 13.

  • January 13: Moon Occults Mars: The Moon will appear to pass in front of Mars for skywatchers in the continental US and Eastern Canada.
  • January 17-18: Venus and Saturn conjunction: The two planets come within just a couple of finger widths' distance apart in the sky.
  • All month – Four planets visible: Venus and Saturn in the southwest, Jupiter high overhead, and Mars in the east.
  • All month – Mars at Opposition: The Red Planet shines brightly all night.
Source: NASA
newTitle: January 2025 Skywatching Tips from NASA: Highlights

title: Mars Helicopter Ingenuity Detects Perseverance Rover During A Flight - MSN
Unborn Babies Use Genes From Dad to “Remote-Control” Mothers for Extra Food - SciTechDaily
summary:
Unborn Babies Use Dad's Genes to Control Mother's Nutrient Supply

Publication Date: 11 July 2023 | Source: Cell Metabolism

Introduction: Scientists at Cambridge have unveiled a fascinating mechanism where fetuses use a paternal gene to control the mother’s nutrient release during pregnancy, creating a delicate balance crucial for both fetal health and maternal well-being.

  • Fetuses use a gene from their father to influence maternal nutrient release.
  • The placenta releases hormones to signal the mother to prioritize the fetus’s growth.
  • This process creates a 'nutritional tug of war' between fetus and mother.
  • The paternal gene 'Igf2' plays a critical role in fetal growth and nutrient allocation.
  • The study indicates a potential conflict of interests between maternal health and fetal needs.
“It’s the first direct evidence that a gene inherited from the father is signaling to the mother to divert nutrients to the fetus.” - Professor Amanda Sferruzzi-Perri

Conclusion: This groundbreaking research sheds light on how the paternal gene Igf2 is crucial for fetal growth and indicates the importance of understanding placental hormone control for improving health outcomes for mothers and their babies.
newTitle: Unborn Babies Use Dad's Genes to Control Mother's Nutrient Supply

title: ‘Dinosaur Highway’ With Hundreds of Jurassic-Era Footprints Found in UK - VICE
summary:
‘Dinosaur Highway’ With Hundreds of Jurassic-Era Footprints Found in UK

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] | Source: [Source Not Provided]

In Dewars Farm Quarry in Oxfordshire, England, paleontologists have discovered over 200 dinosaur footprints from the Jurassic period, around 166 million years ago, referred to as a “dinosaur highway.”

  • The footprints belong to a mix of herbivores and carnivores, including Cetiosaurus and Megalosaurus.
  • The Cetiosaurus resembles the classic Brontosaurus, while the Megalosaurus is notably recognized as the first dinosaur to be scientifically named.
  • Professor Kirsty Edgar highlights the significance of these findings, stating they provide insight into the movements and interactions of dinosaurs in a tropical environment.
  • Modern technology has enhanced the analysis of these footprints, allowing detailed mapping and preservation, which was not possible in previous discoveries.
“These footprints offer an extraordinary window into the lives of dinosaurs, revealing details about their movements, interactions, and the tropical environment they inhabited.” - Professor Kirsty Edgar

The research aims to deepen our understanding of dinosaur behavior and the environment they lived in during the Jurassic period in England.
newTitle: Jurassic-Era Dinosaur Footprints Discovered in UK Quarry

Four Planets Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars set to align for rare night sky spectacle, know date, time and - DNA India
summary:
Four Planets Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars set to align for rare night sky spectacle, know date, time and viewing tip

Date: January 2025 | Source: DNA India

This January, skywatchers will witness a rare celestial display with the alignment of four prominent planets: Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars. Mars will reach opposition on January 15-16, shining brightly.

  • Mars will be at its closest point to Earth since 2022 during its opposition.
  • The alignment will occur in the evening sky, with the best visibility conditions around mid-January.
  • Venus and Saturn will appear close together on January 17 and 18, creating a visually striking conjunction.
  • Jupiter will shine intensely high in the evening sky, adding to the celestial spectacle.
  • A full Moon will pass in front of Mars on January 13, enhancing the viewing experience.
"This rare planetary alignment offers an exciting opportunity for stargazers to witness the wonders of our solar system."

In conclusion, this celestial event provides a unique chance for astronomy enthusiasts to enjoy a stunning display of our solar system's planets.
newTitle: Rare Celestial Alignment: Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars Set to Align in January 2025

title: What's so special about SpaceX's first orbital launch of 2025 - NewsBytes
summary:
What's so special about SpaceX's first orbital launch of 2025

Date: Recent
Source: NewsBytes

SpaceX has achieved a significant milestone by successfully launching its first Falcon 9 rocket of 2025, with the primary mission to deploy the Thuraya 4 satellite into a geosynchronous orbit.

  • The launch took place from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.
  • The Thuraya 4 satellite will provide mobile communication services across Europe, Africa, and the Middle East.
  • The Falcon 9 booster made a successful return, marking its 20th flight and contributing to SpaceX's extensive recovery track record.
  • This launch represents SpaceX's 418th Falcon 9 flight and is part of a year projected to exceed 130 orbital missions.
  • Thuraya 4-NGS satellite includes advanced technology for AI-powered services, representing a leap in space-based communications.
“The technologies on board will unlock innovative AI-powered services.” - Ali Al Hashemi, CEO of Yahsat Space Services

This launch showcases SpaceX's commitment to innovation in space exploration and communication technologies, further solidifying its position as a leader in the aerospace industry.
newTitle: SpaceX's Milestone First Orbital Launch of 2025

title: Fighter aircraft ‘activates its cloaking device’ and people have a lot to say about it - UNILAD
summary:
Fighter aircraft ‘activates its cloaking device’ and people have a lot to say about it

Date & Source: Published by UNILAD

Incredible footage of a fighter aircraft 'activating its cloaking device’ has resurfaced and people can't believe it's real. The footage showcases the F-22 Raptor as it nears the speed of sound, creating what appears to be a 'cloaking effect'.

  • The footage comes from photographer Mark Fingar and shows the F-22 Raptor.
  • The aircraft was known for its advanced technology when developed for the US Air Force.
  • A vapor cone forms as the jet approaches the sound barrier, giving a cloaked appearance.

"Mark Fingar captured an F-22 Raptor activating its cloaking device."

Conclusion

title: Over 200 dinosaur footprints found in UK's 'Dinosaur Highway' - The Jerusalem Post
summary:
Over 200 Dinosaur Footprints Discovered in UK's Dinosaur Highway

Date: January 5, 2025

Source: The Jerusalem Post

Scientists from the universities of Oxford and Birmingham announced the discovery of over 200 fossilized dinosaur footprints at Dewars Farm Quarry in Oxfordshire, marking one of the most significant paleontological finds in Britain in nearly three decades.

  • Discovery site known as the Dinosaur Highway revealed extensive evidence of prehistoric life.
  • Initial discovery made by quarry worker Gary Johnson in June 2024.
  • Excavation involved more than 100 researchers, students, and volunteers, uncovering five distinct trackways.
  • Footprints include both herbivorous and carnivorous dinosaurs, providing insights into the behaviors and environments of Middle Jurassic life.
  • Trackways included large herbivores such as the long-necked Cetiosaurus and the carnivorous theropod Megalosaurus.
  • Research techniques included drone photography and 3D modeling to document the footprints.
“The new tracks expand it into one of the largest sites of dinosaur discoveries in the world.” - Emma Nicholls, vertebrate paleontologist

The recent findings at Dewars Farm Quarry build upon earlier discoveries made in 1997 and will be showcased in an upcoming exhibition at the Oxford University Museum of Natural History.
newTitle: Over 200 Dinosaur Footprints Discovered in UK's Dinosaur Highway

title: Physicists Measure Quantum Geometry of Electrons For First Time - ScienceAlert
summary:
Physicists Measure Quantum Geometry of Electrons For First Time

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Science Alert

A new breakthrough may help scientists solve some of the mysteries of the quantum realm. Physicists have successfully measured the geometrical 'shape' a lone electron adopts while moving through a solid, unlocking a new way of studying the behavior of crystalline solids at the quantum level.

  • The quantum geometric tensor (QGT) is a key measurement that encodes geometric information of quantum states.
  • The research was led by physicists Mingu Kang and Sunjie Kim, with significant contributions from colleagues.
  • This technique may have broad applications beyond the cobalt-tin alloy studied.
  • Quantum geometry can potentially reveal superconductivity in materials where it is typically absent.
“The geometric interpretation of quantum mechanics underpins many recent advances in condensed-matter physics,” said an expert.

This breakthrough offers a new methodological approach that may accelerate experimental activities related to quantum phenomena.
newTitle: Physicists Measure Quantum Geometry of Electrons For First Time

title: “Homo juluensis”: Scientists Claim To Have Discovered New Species of Humans - SciTechDaily
summary:
“Homo juluensis”: Scientists Claim To Have Discovered New Species of Humans

Publication Date: November 2, 2024 | Source: Nature Communications

A University of Hawaiʻi researcher has identified a new species of human, Homo juluensis, that coexisted with Denisovans in Asia. This discovery sheds light on the ancient populations that roamed the region approximately 300,000 to 50,000 years ago.

  • Homo juluensis may include enigmatic groups such as the Denisovans.
  • The species is based on new fossil evidence from eastern Asia.
  • Research is led by anthropologist Christopher J. Bae, with findings published in Nature Communications.
  • The study proposes a new organizational method for ancient human fossils.
“This study clarifies a hominin fossil record that has tended to include anything that cannot easily be assigned to Homo erectus, Homo neanderthalensis, or Homo sapiens,” said Bae.

This groundbreaking work enhances our understanding of human evolution in Asia and highlights the importance of organizing fossil evidence while filling gaps in our understanding of ancient human relatives.
newTitle: New Human Species 'Homo juluensis' Discovered by Researchers

title: How the humble fruit fly transformed research on genes, tissue, disease & evolution - ThePrint
summary:
How the Humble Fruit Fly Transformed Research in Genetics and Beyond

Publication Date: 2023-10-04 | Source: The Conversation

The common fruit fly, or Drosophila melanogaster, has been a pivotal species in scientific research for over a century, leading to significant discoveries in genetics, disease control, and evolution.

  • The fruit fly originates from the woodlands of south-central Africa and has a unique association with human communities.
  • It is extensively used in genetics research, having contributed to foundational discoveries about genes and chromosomes.
  • The species plays a vital role in understanding tissue damage and regeneration, particularly in cancer research.
  • It has contributed to disease control efforts, specifically in combating diseases like dengue through the use of Wolbachia bacteria.
  • Fruit flies are also used to study evolutionary processes, especially in the conservation of threatened species.
“Drosophila melanogaster has contributed to our well-being. Perhaps admire it rather than reaching for that can of fly spray.”

The humble fruit fly is much more than a nuisance; it has profoundly impacted various fields of research and continues to be an invaluable tool for scientists.
newTitle: How the Humble Fruit Fly Transformed Research in Genetics and Beyond

title: NASA's Stunning New Image Reveals Dust Devils in Action on Mars - ScienceAlert
summary:
NASA's Stunning New Image Reveals Dust Devils in Action on Mars

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Universe Today

An incredible image of Mars has been released, capturing the relentless activity of dust devils swirling across the planet's surface. These Martian whirlwinds form, move across the surface, and dissipate before others take their place.

  • The image was taken by the HiRISE camera aboard NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter in September 2022.
  • Scientists are studying the tracks of dust devils to understand Martian atmospheric processes better.
  • Mars is often referred to as the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish color, caused by iron oxide.
  • Dust devils on Mars help redistribute dust across the planet's surface, influencing weather patterns and climate.
  • They can affect solar panels by both depositing dust that blocks sunlight and cleaning panels through strong winds.
An image recently released by NASA JPL shows dust devils tracking across the surface of Mars. Teams of astronomers are studying their fading tracks to calculate the rate of deposition of dust over time.

This study is essential for safeguarding future space missions to Mars.
newTitle: NASA's Stunning New Image Reveals Dust Devils in Action on Mars

title: Sun Blasts Strong M7.9 Solar Flare Viewed From NASA Spacecraft - MSN
Astronomers trace mysterious radio burst to distant neutron star - News9 LIVE
summary:
Astronomers Trace Mysterious Radio Burst to Distant Neutron Star

Date: New Delhi

Source: Science News

Fast Radio Bursts (FRBs) can release massive energy in a fraction of a second, outshining even entire black holes. A team from MIT has successfully traced one such FRB, known as 20221022A, to its source about 200 million light-years away, demonstrating its origin from the magnetosphere of a neutron star.

  • FRBs originate from highly dense and exotic objects like neutron stars and black holes.
  • The first FRB was detected in 2007, with thousands logged subsequently.
  • The researchers used scintillation patterns to identify their location with more precision.
  • This marks the first time an FRB's origin has been definitively linked to a neutron star's magnetosphere.
“In these environments of neutron stars, the magnetic fields are really at the limits of what the universe can produce.” – Kenzie Nimmo

This discovery may reshape our understanding of neutron stars and their energetic emissions, paving the way for future research in astrophysics.
newTitle: Astronomers Trace Mysterious Radio Burst to Distant Neutron Star

title: Astronomers trace mysterious radio beam to distant neutron star - News9 LIVE
summary:
Astronomers Trace Mysterious Radio Beam to Distant Neutron Star

Publication Date: Recent; Source: Science News

Fast Radio Bursts (FRBs) are powerful energy emissions from dense objects like neutron stars. Astronomers have traced one such FRB to a neutron star's magnetosphere for the first time, marking a significant breakthrough in understanding these cosmic phenomena.

  • The FRB identified is designated as 20221022A, originating from 200 million light-years away.
  • Astronomers used scintillation techniques to pinpoint the FRB's location.
  • This research confirms the first instance of an FRB originating from a neutron star's magnetosphere.
  • The findings were published in the journal Nature, with lead author Kenzie Nimmo highlighting the extreme magnetic fields involved.
“In these environments of neutron stars, the magnetic fields are really at the limits of what the universe can produce. There’s been a lot of debate about whether this bright radio emission could even escape from that extreme plasma.” - Kenzie Nimmo

This discovery enhances our understanding of the behavior of neutron stars and could pave the way for future research into similar cosmic events.
newTitle: Astronomers Trace Mysterious Radio Beam to Distant Neutron Star

title: New research reveals RNA on leaves may impact microbial communities - Phys.org
summary:
New Research Shows RNA on Leaf Surfaces May Influence Microbial Communities

Published on: January 5, 2025 | Source: Phys.org

Biologists at Indiana University Bloomington have discovered diverse RNA molecules on the surfaces of plant leaves, suggesting that these RNAs could play a role in shaping microbial communities and influencing plant health.

  • The study was published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.
  • First authors: Lucía Borniego and Meenu Singla-Rastogi.
  • Senior author: Roger Innes.
  • Discovery suggests plants may control their microbiomes via cross-kingdom RNA interference (RNAi).
  • RNA found on leaves appears to be stable and can interact with microbes, potentially affecting gene expression.
“What excites us most about this discovery is that it indicates plants may control their microbiomes, in part, by regulating gene expression in microbes using cross-kingdom RNA interference, also known as RNAi.” - Roger Innes

This research reveals that plants might influence their surrounding microbial communities, with possible implications for both ecology and human health.
newTitle: New Research Shows RNA on Leaf Surfaces May Influence Microbial Communities

title: SpaceX launches Falcon 9 from Florida in first flight of the year - Space Daily
summary:
SpaceX launches Falcon 9 from Florida in first flight of the year

Date: Jan 4, 2024 Source: UPI

SpaceX successfully launched its first flight of 2025, sending a Falcon 9 rocket with a Thuraya 4 satellite into space.

  • Falcon 9 rocket took off at 8:27 p.m. EST from Cape Canaveral.
  • The booster landed on the droneship 'A Shortfall of Gravitas' in the Atlantic Ocean.
  • This was the 20th flight and recovery for this Falcon 9 first stage booster.
  • The Thuraya 4 satellite was deployed into geostationary transfer orbit 35 minutes after launch.
  • The satellite is operated by Space42, formed from a merger of Yahsat and Bayanat.
  • With 418 launches, this was SpaceX's 435th mission overall.
  • Upcoming Falcon 9 launches planned for Starlink satellites from Cape Canaveral.
"SpaceX closed out 2024 with a New Year's Eve launch from Florida."

This launch marks another successful mission for SpaceX as they continue to expand their satellite deployment and recovery capabilities.
newTitle: SpaceX Launches Falcon 9 Rocket from Florida

title: Crystal-Based Cooling Technology Could Offer Sustainable Solution for Fridges and Air Conditioners - Passionategeekz
Crystal-Based Cooling Technology Could Offer Sustainable Solution for Fridges and Air Conditioners - Gadgets 360
summary:
Crystal Cooling Technology Could Change How We Cool Fridges and AC Units

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Gadgets 360

A novel crystal-based technology has been identified as a potential solution for sustainable cooling systems that aim to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

How the Technology Works

This technology utilizes plastic crystals which transform under pressure to absorb heat, providing a climate-friendly alternative to traditional refrigerants.

  • Operates effectively between -37°C and 10°C, suitable for household refrigeration.

Challenges in Implementation

Major hurdles include high-pressure requirements for practical application, alongside concerns about long-term performance due to molecular strain.

Potential Impact

Experts believe this innovation could significantly reduce the environmental footprint of refrigeration, though further research is needed for widespread adoption.

"Could help decarbonise the cooling industry." - David Boldrin, University of Glasgow
newTitle: Crystal Cooling Technology Could Change How We Cool Fridges and AC Units
